title: Perideridia montana - Montana yampah
description: Perideridia montana growing along seepages in an otherwise open dry montane meadow or parkland surrounded by forests comprising mostly Douglas Fir (Pseudotsuga menziesii). Yampah is an abundant forb in this area of open vegetation especially along draws where the vegetation has a taller stature. This site lies along the main gravel road just west of Burley Peak between Sapphire Village and Checkerboard, central eastern Little Belt Mountains, Judith Basin County, Montana.
label: Original
